article_title: CMS Eyes New Anti-Fraud Steps Against Hospices
article_text:
CMS Eyes New Anti-Fraud Steps Against Hospices

Law360, New York (January 14, 2015, 1:42 PM ET) -- The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services intends to develop new anti-fraud measures targeting hospices that make few visits to patients, according to an inspector general’s report Tuesday that raised numerous questions about billing practices in certain settings.



CMS, which under the Affordable Care Act is engaged in a wide-ranging overhaul of hospice payments, revealed the plans in response to a report that examined billing for care delivered in so-called assisted living facilities, or ALFs.
